alert.note: Alert for Wayne (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 09 at 12:55PM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Choctaw and northern Wayne Counties through 145 PM CST... At 1255 PM CST, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 4 miles east of Mill Creek, or 14 miles west of Waynesboro, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Choctaw and northern Wayne Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM CST for southwestern Alabama...and southeastern Mississippi.
